etymology.description: indicative: 木 (mù ‘tree’) with its bottom highlighted by an extra stroke to accentuate the roots; contrast 末, 朱.
etymology.interpretation: Emphasizes the base of a tree to point to the idea of origin, foundation, or root. The extra stroke marks the bottom, distinguishing it from 末, which highlights the top.

examples.chinese: 以史为本(以史為本)，可以知兴替(可以知興替)。
examples.pinyin: Yǐ shǐ wéi běn, kěyǐ zhī xīngtì.
examples.english: Taking history as the basis allows one to understand rise and decline.

examples.chinese: 事情的本质很重要(事情的本質很重要)。
examples.english: The fundamental nature of the matter is very important.

examples.chinese: 我们要回到问题的本源来思考(我們要回到問題的本源來思考)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yào huídào wèntí de běnyuán lái sīkǎo.
examples.english: We need to return to the origin of the problem to think it through.
